data.title: Carlsquare Corporate Finance
data.meta_description: Over 100 years of combined international experience. Meet the professional and dedicated team members of Carlsquare Corporate Finance.
data.text:
Jorge Abugaber joined Carlsquare in 2023 as Managing Partner for Poland & CEE. Jorge has more than 15 years of experience in investment banking. He previously worked as Managing Director at Santander Corporate & Investment Banking responsible for the TMT, consumer, retail and healthcare sectors. Prior to that he worked for Trigon Investment Banking in Warsaw and for J.P. Morgan in New York City.

Jorge graduated from Harvard College in 2008 with an A.B. in Economics and a secondary degree in Psychology. He is a Chartered Financial Analyst and a Certified Advisor on the Warsaw Stock Exchange ASO. Jorge is a native speaker of English and Spanish and is fluent in Polish.

Kevin joined Carlsquare through the merger with Capital Clarity and has been with the firm since 2022. He has over 25 years of financial industry experience encompassing M&A and capital raising activities for both private and public companies. Kevin previously worked at D.A. Davidson, Houlihan Lokey, ArchPoint Partners, NASDAQ, UBS and Robertson Stephens. He is a graduate of St. John’s University and the University of Maryland.

Susan Blanco is a successful female founder and recognized leader in technology investment banking. Her extensive experience includes mergers, acquisitions, dividend recapitalizations, public and private capital raising. She has executed numerous transactions for public and private companies with leading private equity sponsors and global corporations including IBM, Hitachi, Intuit, McKesson, Verisk, British Telecom, Sabre and Google.

Susan joined Carlsquare in 2023 through the merger with Capital Clarity, the San Francisco-based technology investment bank she founded with John Cooper. Previously, Susan was Managing Director and Head of West Coast Private Equity at SNH Capital, Managing Director in Houlihan Lokey’s Technology Group, co-founder and Managing Director of ArchPoint Partners and Vice President at J.P. Morgan.

She holds a B.S. in Engineering Physics from the University of California, Berkeley, and an M.S. in Materials Science and Engineering from Stanford University.

Anders graduated with a M.Sc. in Finance and Accounting from Copenhagen Business School and University of Michigan and is a Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA).

Anders has successfully closed numerous corporate-finance transactions since 1996 within the fields of M&A, public-tender offers, private placements, rights issues and IPOs.

Anders worked at WestLB Panmure Investment Bank, Gudme Raaschou Bankaktieselskab and HSH Corporate Finance before co-founding Dansk Merchant Capital in 2007. In March 2019, the corporate-finance activities of Dansk Merchant Capital were acquired by Carlsquare.

Gwanaelle joined Carlsquare in 2022, having previously served as a Senior Consultant in the Transfer Pricing division of KPMG Switzerland. Prior to that she worked as a Financial Corporate Tax Consultant for PWC Belgium. She holds a Master’s in Finance from the Louvain School of Management, an Executive Master’s in Tax Law from the ICHEC Brussels Management School as well as a Bachelor’s in Economics and Management, from the Catholic University of Louvain.

John Cooper is a respected leader and advisor to technology and healthcare IT companies. He has led the execution of numerous notable mergers, acquisitions, investments and recapitalizations across public and private companies.

Cooper joined Carlsquare in 2023 through the merger with Capital Clarity, the San Francisco-based technology investment bank he founded with Susan Blanco. Previously, Cooper led technology investment banking practices at Houlihan Lokey, ArchPoint Partners and Montgomery & Co, was President of ThinkTank software incubator funded by SoftBank and led Corporate Development for Microsoft, McKesson, First Data and American Express.

He holds a B.S. in Business and Finance from the University of Minnesota and has completed post-graduate work in executive leadership at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT).

Dr. Manfred Drax has been Partner at Carlsquare since 2013. He studied law in Munich and Freiburg im Breisgau and business administration at the FernUniversität Hagen. At the University of Bayreuth he received his doctorate in corporate and group law. Manfred has more than 20 years of experience in medical technology, life sciences and other sectors.

Sebastian has been with Carlsquare since 2011. He has more than 10 years of experience in M&A, among others at Cobalt Corporate Finance (London) and goetzpartners (Munich). At Carlsquare, his focus is on software, business services and life sciences transactions. He studied Business Administration with a focus on Corporate Finance and Accounting in Mannheim (Germany) and Lund (Sweden).

Jens-Christian has been a Director at Carlsquare since August 2024. He brings over 14 years of experience in M&A, having gained extensive expertise in M&A execution and deal origination at prestigious investment banks like Merrill Lynch and Barclays, as well as leading consulting firms such as PwC and EY. At EY, he headed Deal Origination for GSA.

His career also includes significant roles in the FinTech and start-up sectors, notably as Head of Partnerships for Europe at the private equity platform Moonfare and as Chief Investment Officer at Media and Games Invest. He served also as Managing Director at the financing platform Fundingport.

Jens-Christian holds a degree in Business Administration from the University of Passau, with a focus on corporate valuation and accounting, and is a CFA Charterholder.

Daniel Garlipp graduated with a degree in business administration from the University of Regensburg and the Hanken School of Economics in Helsinki. He has many years of experience in corporate finance with a focus on company valuation and financial and commercial due diligence. Prior to Carlsquare, Daniel worked for KPMG Corporate Finance (Hamburg), Kuna & Co. (Frankfurt) and Roland Berger Strategy Consultants (Munich).

Daniel Gebler joined Carlsquare in 2023 as Head of Debt Advisory. He has over 20 years of debt experience, with particular expertise in LBO, project, infrastructure, corporate and real-estate financings. Previously Daniel was Managing Director at DC Advisory, where he oversaw non-distressed debt advisory for both the DACH and CEE regions. Before that he spent more than a decade on the lender side, heading an LBO team at Commerzbank and serving as Vice President in the LBO and infrastructure team at Dresdner Kleinwort. Daniel holds a Diploma in Business Administration from the Humboldt University of Berlin.

Hans joined Carlsquare in 2023 with more than 25 years of international business and cross-border M&A experience. He has 6 years advisory experience on acquisitions and joint-venture projects between Europe and China across a wide range of industries from his own company. In addition, he spent 15 years being posted in Taipei, Shanghai, Beijing and Chongqing, for several MNCs and the Danish Trade Council where he acquired skills to negotiate effectively in Mandarin. Besides M&A consulting, Hans is also a seasoned emerging markets business developer in Consumer Product from Nestle, Scandinavian Tobacco, etc.. He holds a B.Sc. degree in Economics and a MBA in International Business, and certificates in Corporate Finance and Management Consulting.

Michael joined Carlsquare in 2024 from Kroll, where he served as Director in the Technology Investment Banking team (Pagemill Partners) and helped build-up the firm’s European tech practice.

Previously, Michael gained experience in tech investment banking at Bulger Partners and The Macquarie Group. He holds a BSC in Money, Banking and Finance from the University of Birmingham and an MSc in Economics from the LSE.

Lars is an industry advisor to Carlsquare in the field of IT&Telecom. He has a M.Sc in engineering physics and +30 years of experience working for large operators and solution suppliers such as Telia, Ericsson, MCI Worldcom and Huawei as well as a range of start-up companies. For the past 8 years Lars has been with Huawei acting as business consultant and leading operators across Europe in legacy network and business transformation.

Morten graduated with a M.Sc. in Economics from the University of Copenhagen.

More than 20 years of experience in advisory services on M&A, IPOs, secondaries and private placements.

Morten has worked with Nordea Securities, HSH Corporate Finance, Dansk Merchant Capital and a number of years as adviser, partner and CEO of one of the leading Danish agencies focusing on strategic and financial communication.

Herman joined Carlsquare in 2022. He has previous experience, both as a consultant and inhouse, in business development and M&A within the Med-Tech sector. Herman is focused on the Life Science sector and holds a B.Sc. degree in Business and Economics from Lund University with a major in Corporate finance and exchange studies at St.Gallen University in Switzerland.

Tanja joined Carlsquare in 2022 and has over 15 years of experience in Human Resources. Previously, she worked as Deputy HR Manager at a globally operating service sector corporation. Prior to that, she held various HR positions in retail and with a project developer (DOUGLAS Group, ECE). She studied Economics and Business at the University of Witten/Herdecke and the University of Stellenbosch. She began her professional career with an apprenticeship at the banking house B. Metzler seel. Sohn & Co.

Steffen Leckert joined Carlsquare in 2021 with more than 25 years of experience in investment banking. He previously worked as Managing Director at Houlihan Lokey, where he was responsible for European corporate finance in industrial technology and packaging. Prior to that he worked for Lincoln International as Head of Industrials as well as running the firm’s corporate-coverage activities in the DACH region. Steffen has also had positions at Mediobanca leading the German industrial and automotive team and at Bank of America Merrill Lynch working with private-equity clients and automotive-supply companies.

Erik joined Carlsquare in 2017. He has more than 15 years of M&A experience, with a particular focus on technology companies. He has previously worked at Stella EOC (now part of Houlihan Lokey) and EY. Erik holds a M.Sc. in Industrial Engineering from Chalmers University of Technology and a B.Sc. in Business Administration and Management from University of Gothenburg.

Jasmine joined Carlsquare in 2024. Before she spent nine years in Berlin’s dynamic tech startup scene, mastering various skills while maintaining a holistic view of how companies operate. She is passionate about streamlining processes to ensure businesses function seamlessly. In recent years, she has focused on learning about exciting technologies like blockchain and artificial intelligence. Notably, she played a crucial role in the growth of a leading decentralized blockchain company, expanding its team from 70 to 210 people in just 2.5 years.

Her impactful contributions, strategic initiatives, and hands-on experience have prepared her to provide a fresh perspective, enhance operational efficiency, and drive exponential growth within Carlsquare. Jasmine holds a Bachelor’s degree in Economics and Management from the University of Luxembourg.

Travis joined Carlsquare through the merger with Capital Clarity and has been with the firm since 2019. He has extensive experience across sellside and buyside M&A, capital raises, private equity and public equity investing. He was previously with SNH Capital, Graham Partners, and Brandes Investment Partners. Travis holds a Master’s of Business Administration from The Wharton School and is a CFA Charter Holder.

Mandy joined Carlsquare in March 2020. As the former Head of Operations, she has strengthened our HR team as Recruiting Manager since August 2023.

As a qualified industrial clerk and business administrator, she has already gained over ten years of experience in the organisation and professionalisation of administrative and operational company processes. In her role as Recruiting Manager, she represents Carlsquare as an employer and is actively searching for new talents.

Mark Miller is one of the founders of Carlsquare (formerly CatCap). He studied economics and business at the University of Witten / Herdecke and at the University of Texas at Austin. He worked for Deutsche Bank in the corporate and asset-management business and as an analyst at Bertelsmann AG, where he examined strategic investment opportunities. Overall, Mark has participated in more than 100 successful transactions.

Michael Moritz is one of the founders of Carlsquare (formerly CatCap). He studied liberal arts at Albion College in Michigan, USA and economics and law in Freiburg, Berlin, Cologne and Bonn. He then worked at the Treuhandanstalt in Berlin on the restructuring and privatization of medium-sized investments. Michael also served as corporate finance consultant at Doertenbach & Co. in Frankfurt, where specialized in advising medium-sized companies and their owners on strategic acquisitions and divestitures.

Mathias Möhrpahl joined Carlsquare in 2023. He has more than 15 years of experience in M&A, corporate advisory, business development and renewable energy and has lived and worked in several countries across Europe, North & South America as well as SE Asia. Before he joined Carlsquare, Mathias was a Partner at Uruguayan-based Ficus Advisory, where he focused mainly on wind, solar and other renewable energy transactions worldwide. Since 2021, he is also a member of the Advisory Panel at New Energy Partners, Greece. He studied economics at Cologne and Kiel University and earned a MSc in Economics from Birkbeck College, University of London. He is a native German speaker and is fluent in English, Spanish and Portuguese.

Eiji has over a decade of M&A experience, having previously held posts at Torch Partners, RBC, Lazard and Houlihan Lokey in London, Hong Kong and Tokyo. His core areas of expertise include the digital-consumer, internet, software and industrial-technology sectors. A native Japanese speaker, Eiji maintains close ties with numerous Japanese strategics. He holds an MSc in Geophysics from Kyoto University and has also studied at Grenoble University.

Sascha joined Carlsquare in 2024, focusing on IT services and Software. Previously, Sascha was a Director at Alantra and advised on numerous M&A sell-side and buy-side transactions for private equity investors and corporate clients. He started his career at IKB Deutsche Industriebank in 2014, working in M&A and Leveraged Finance. Sascha holds a B.Sc. in International Business Economics and a M.Sc. in International Business Finance from Maastricht University with an extended stay at the National University of Singapore.

Laura has been working at Carlsquare since 2024. Prior to that, she gained relevant professional experience in M&A and Corporate Finance at Deloitte, Deutsche Bahn, and WTS Advisory. In addition to a Master’s in Finance from HULT International Business School in London, Laura completed a dual study program that included an apprenticeship as a bank clerk and a Bachelor’s degree in Economics at the Friedrich-Alexander University of Erlangen-Nuremberg.

Luc is an experienced international M&A advisor with particular expertise in the field of industrial technology. Luc focuses on dynamically growing companies that use digitalization, automation and improved efficiency to enable disruptive change in areas such as research & development, manufacturing, farming, defense, environmental monitoring and energy transition. He has also closely followed the growing European cannabis market, advising several of the field’s pioneers.

Before joining Carlsquare, Luc was a Managing Director at Bryan Garnier in Munich and then Stockholm. He has also worked at SMBC in London and ams OSRAM in Munich. Luc holds an MSC in Accounting and Finance from the London School of Economics, a Master in Management from EDHEC Business School, and a BSc in Political Science and Economics from the Institut d’Etudes Politiques de Lyon.

Alexander joined Carlsquare in 2021, having previously worked at Deloitte in financial due diligence, at SEB in project financing and PwC in corporate finance. Alexander holds an M.Sc. in Finance from Stockholm School of Economics and a B.Sc. in Business and Economics from Vienna University of Economics and Business.

Caspar Graf Stauffenberg studied business administration in Reutlingen and London. He then worked as a project manager for Arthur D. Little in the strategy and organization division and as project manager for M&A at the Binding Group (today: Radeberger).

Prior to joining Carlsquare, he was CFO and later CEO of MAP Medizin-Technologie GmbH and CEO and co-founder of Aequos Endoprosthetics GmbH. Both companies were sold under his direction.

Berthold Stauffenberg has a track record of more than 30 years in investment banking. He co-founded Alexander Partners in 2015 and previously worked as Managing Director at Crédit Agricole Corporate & Investment Bank and Managing Director at Rothschild in Paris and Frankfurt. He holds an MBA from Insead and BSc (Hons) Economics from University of London.

Griffin joined Carlsquare in 2021 after moving from Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada. Griffin holds a bachelor’s in finance and accounting from the University of British Columbia (UBC). Previously, he worked at Ernst & Young (EY) where he received his Chartered Professional Accountancy (CPA), before joining a regional M&A boutique, Sequiera Partners, in their insurance and professional services practice.

Jon joined Carlsquare in 2020 in London, and spent time in the Berlin office before opening the Vancouver office in 2023. Prior to that, he worked at Canaccord Genuity in London advising technology companies on M&A and fundraising. He started his career at Hyperwallet, a fintech startup, which eventually sold to PayPal for $500m. He is a Chartered Accountant, and a graduate of Simon Fraser University and the University of British Columbia.

Philip joined Carlsquare in 2022. Prior to Carlsquare, he has already gained more than five years of M&A experience from BDO Corporate Finance and Faqtum M&A. He has successfully closed numerous transactions within Industrials, B2B services and Consumer/Internet. Philip holds a degree in Economics from University of Colorado Boulder, and certified Financial Modeling and Valuation Analyst by CFI (Corporate Finance Institute).

Sybille joined Carlsquare in 2020. Following a dual degree in Business Administration at the University of Applied Sciences Bremen and the Ecole Supérieure Commerce Marseille-Provence she worked at Deutsche Bank, initially in Munich followed by Morgan Grenfell in London. There she then joined Mercury Asset Management and Merrill Lynch Investment Managers (MLIM), part of BlackRock since 2006.

Constantin von Wiedersperg started his career at UniCredit Corporate & Investment Banking in 2010. Since then, Constantin focused on structured finance and capital markets and gained extensive transaction experience in commercial real estate and corporate finance on both the advisory and execution side. Prior to joining Carlsquare, he was responsible for sponsor coverage and leveraged finance for the small cap segment with a particular focus on corporates in Germany, Austria, and Switzerland. Before earning a diploma degree in business administration from the University of Nürtingen-Geislingen (HfWU), he underwent a three-year training to become an infantry officer in the German armed forces.

Dennis joined Carlsquare in 2021. He previously gained experience at DekaBank Deutsche Girozentrale and Deutsche Bank, among others. He holds a master’s degree in finance & management from St Andrews University and did his bachelor’s studies in Business Administration at Leuphana University Lüneburg, paired with a semester abroad at the University of Sydney.

Frederik joined Carlsquare in 2018. He has previously worked at UniCredit and Berenberg. Frederik holds a joint MSc in Finance from the Nova School of Business and Economics and the Sao Paulo School of Economics and a BSc in Business Administration from the University of Hamburg.

Nils joined Carlsquare from Deloitte in London, where he worked within the M&A advisory team. He has gained M&A experience since 2010, mainly advising technology companies on buy and sell side transactions within the mid-market. Nils holds a degree in Economics from the Rheinische Friedrich-Wilhelms-Universität Bonn.

Andreas Zetzsche was Group Head of M&A at RWE for many years. Operating out of the firm’s Essen headquarters, Andreas led numerous significant M&A transactions, including capital-markets deals. He was previously Managing Director of the European Chemical Group at Chase Manhattan Bank in London. Since 2018, he has been Chair Affiliate of Mergers & Acquisitions at the WHU Otto Beisheim School of Management.
